Author: 15 January 2018
Review_Url: An hilarious romantic comedy that tells a beautiful story by depicting awful truths. It's Bill Murray at his best, and it has an unquestionably powerful message that can be appreciated and, at the same time, enjoyed.

Author: 12 May 2017
Review_Url: But somehow, in this movie, he's great. Go figure. The bit with the groundhog is gold. His numerous suicides are hilarious. I love the look on his face when he realizes it's groundhog day, AGAIN.

Author: 9 June 1999
Review_Url: Witty, original, romantic - what more do you want? Definitely one of those "two level" films - you can enjoy it just for Murray's hilarious antics and the sharp script, but this a story that is really about something. Most attempts at the Redemption theme end up being either heavy handed or so platitudinous that you want to throw up. Here Ramis handles it so deftly you will wonder if this really is the same buffoon from SCTV.

Author: 7 October 2001
Review_Url: Of itself, the movie missed perfection. But the idea saved a relationship. Being a man, I often say the wrong thing. I had made a terrible mistake in telling a close friend -- happened to be a woman -- something that totally upset her. The only thing that saved the relationship was being able to ask her for another chance like the one given to Phil Connors in the movie. Since then, when I say or do something stupid, I can get a second chance by asking for another Groundhog Day.

Author: 10 February 2023
Review_Url: This movie has always been a childhood favourite of mine and one I consider to be one of the most rewatchable movies of all time. I still watch it over and over and never get tired of it. Bill Murray is a legend, and he was top notch in this movie. The plot of this movie is also creative, a weatherman who does a report on the groundhog and has to relive Groundhog's day every single day and he eventually loses his mind and ends up breaking the law and doing crazy things since he wakes up everyday starting the day all over again. I give this movie a 10/10 for it's witty humor, it's memorable characters and storyline.

Author: 8 January 2022
Review_Url: Groundhog Day, by Harold Ramis is brilliant! Rightfully so, a lot of the comedy is based on the ridiculousness of the actual day. One of my favorites as it has it all: Laughs, love, action, despair. It's one of those script concepts that writes itself with the premise. This film alone created the notion of groundhogs day as a measure of deja-vu and stuck-ness.

Author: 1 July 2016

I mean I get that not many are going to love this review and no film has ever been loved by everyone but I honestly don't understand the colt following of this.

Author: 10 April 2006
Review: A fantastic concept, brilliantly cast and wonderfully directed.
Review_Url: A film that was perhaps underrated by critics upon its release, Groundhog Day is a classic example of a film that has spread through word of mouth. Bill Murray is perfectly cast as the grumpy weatherman whose egotistical character would rather be in the studio than out on location. Andie MacDowell is equally great as the kind and caring 'environmentally friendly' love interest that contrasts diligently with Murrays bullish persona. The concept is something that almost every person has toyed with at one point or another - what would happen if tomorrow I woke up and re-lived today. With this in mind Groundhog Day manages to investigate this notion with humour, wit and a sense of class that makes it stand out as a great movie that will, I'm sure, endure the very thing it explores - time.

Author: 1 October 1999
Review_Url: A wonderful film. We have a family tradition of watching this movie once a year -- on Groundhog's Day, of course. A good, clean, funny film (sometimes eerie) with a good message. Good family film. Sweet.

Author: 2 March 2000
Review: I loved it, much better than "Cats" I have seen it again and again.
Review_Url: Without a doubt this movie is Bill Murray's finest work to date.  While the movie is hilarious from start to finish, it achieves the level of genius as it captures one man's transformation from an ego-centric weatherman who can't find any meaning in his life, to that of a man content with his simple being.

Author: 20 July 2001
Review_Url: Only one word can resume what this film is: Perfection. This instant comedy classic is a fable about making things go right. Murray plays a weather reporter who wakes up on the same day in a boring town over and over. When the situation becomes a chance the film moves from straight comedy to romantic comedy without a problem. A totally round story, an sensible direction and a nice casting with a fabulous Bill Murray playing his character with a touch of cinisism that never lets the film become corny, and one of the best screenplay that I've ever seen, are the ingredients that makes this film a jewel. "Run Lola Run", the Germanic flick is exactly about the same topic, see both films.

Author: 2 February 2001
Review: One of the best movies ever, a delight
Review_Url: With the notable exception of film critics, everyone who has seen this movie loves it.  It seems that Hollywood is stuck with about seven basic plots. Here's a movie that is totally different. A new idea, a comment on our humanity, a metaphor for our lives, and we're not scolded about our failings, we're allowed to laugh as we learn - what were the critics thinking about with their ho hum reviews?

Author: 19 February 2002
Review_Url: This is my favorite film. Its deep meanings are so true and its comedy so fresh that I must give it the most prestigious position I have for a movie. And as a general warning those who dislike or only moderately like this film be prepared for a rougher time becoming my friend. I don't accept that "Groundhog Day" can be simply dismissed as a romance movie or a comedy, because it possesses a messages that are frighteningly profound and applicable to our world.

Author: 18 December 2019
Review_Url: Slow in the middle but loved it overall a great classic film

Author: 1 February 1999
Review_Url: I,m sure I've seen this film before. It was even better the 2nd time, the 3rd time, the 4th time and on and on and on.

Author: 13 February 1999
Review_Url: If this film had been made four decades ago it would not have surprised me to see Frank Capra's name attached to it. This is ironic as one of his most celebrated movies, It's a Wonderful Life was also hugely underrated in its day and in fact was slated by some critics. The difference between these films is that Harold Ramis is not held in the same esteem as Frank Capra, at least not at present. In order for that to happen Harold will need to make a film of the same acclaim as 'Mr Smith goes to Washington'. Things could easily change.

Review_Url: In addition to all the praise that this movie has received from the other reviewers, I would like to point out that the philosophy of this movie runs pretty deep if you look at it carefully.

Review: This is a funny movie, this is a funny movie, this is a funny movie, and then it ends
Review_Url: The power of this movie is that it goes on and on and on just as the story. As soon as the movie stops repeating itself, it becomes a boring Hollywood flick. Nevertheless the repeating is so funny the movie is well above average.

Author: 4 November 2013
Review_Url: This is one of my most favourite films. Every time I watch this, it brings me back to the innocence and charm that only films in the 90s seemed to have. Other films which contained this magic are ones like Mrs Doubtfire and Hook. Every time I watch this movie, I always imagined what it would be like to live in this nice small tight-knit community.

Author: 27 November 2000
Review_Url: Phil Connors,a sarcastic weather man disappointed from his boring life the 2nd of February of every year goes to a lost little city in Pennsilvanya to shoot a reportage about an old local tradition "The Groundhog day",where a nice big rat,like Phil calls it,seems able to preview the last of the winter and the came of the spring..but this time something of really strange happens,Phil ,for a joke of the destiny (or who knows what else..)is obliged to live the same day for hundred of times ,so every day ,for his desperation,he's woke up at 6:00 am by the same song at the radio and meets always the same people who obviously don't realize what is going on and can't understand his drama. I think this one the best comedy of the 90s not only for the Brilliant performance of Bill Murray (absolutely perfect in this role)but in particular for the deeper meaning of the story. In fact Phil's life is a disaster he's selfish,presumptuous, cinic and only when he changes his nature,stopping to use this absurd situation for his goals ,things will be better for him and the 2nd of February finally will be the 3rd!.So knowing perfectly the things of the day he's forced to live ever he starts helping people : save a child who's falling form a tree,save a man hit by an heart attack and so on in this way he also conquest the woman of his dreams (Andy McDowell).So this film is  a metaphor.Each of us after all live always the same day (wake at the same time,make the same job,see the same people)without realizing it,maybe we should make like Phil and try to change ,even just a bit,to be better person and to feel better ,is it so difficult ?..

Author: 24 October 2002
Review_Url: This is the best movie i have ever seen in my life. You just can't compare this to another movie. All of you people out there must realize this is simply the best film ever made.

Author: 14 July 2022
Review_Url: I know it through a book called Mindset-.... of PhD Dweck. And I just watched the review of Groundhog Day but it presents the movie so well. This is a meaningful movie.

Author: 26 September 2002
Review_Url: Groundhog Day is of the funniest movies ever released or even remotely thought up of by cinema makers. Bill Murray is at his greatest with outstanding lines of sarcastic replies and obvious insults to whoever his victim may be. Harold Ramis wrote and directed this film, as he has so many other fine pieces of film. Ramis also had a small role as a doctor in this film. Andie McDowel had a key role in this movie as the woman Murray's character is in love with. I usually find McDowel's accent and her acting quite annoying, but this is one of her better films. Saturday Night Live's Chris Elliott had a supporting role as "Larry" and he played his part very well. I believed he was better than Andie McDowel in some certain points. There is nothing that is not funny about this very entertaining film. Groundhog Day is about one man's experience through a day of hell that will never end- Groundhog Day. He tries to shoot,electrocute,stap,get run over by a Semi truck, but he always wakes up on one day- Groundhog Day. The "Academy" failed to award an outstanding film the awards it deserved. Groundhog Day is a film that all should experience. Bill Murray will definitely make you laugh. I would highly recommend that you rent this film because it is a highly wonderful piece of entertainment that all will enjoy!

He meet the producer and change his personalty. finally he fall in love with his producer and it had a happy end. we watched this movie in my culture class and we had no popcrond :) . but i learnd a little bit about American tradition. it was nice to learn morn about the USA and learn more personalty. i love American movies a lot and speaking about this is interesting to see how much money the producer spend to make a film.

Author: 23 August 2021
Review: Not worth it unless you're watching it for nostalgia
Review_Url: Groundhog day should've stayed in the 90s. I'm watching it for the first time in 2021 and I can say that the only way this movie would be good is if I was watching it for nostalgic reasons. Just like Shrek.

Author: 15 December 2010
Review_Url: Harold Ramis's film "Groundhog Day" revolves around bill Murrays character "Phil", a miserable weatherman forced to once again go on assignment to Pauxatuany to cover the annual Groundhog Day celebration. After forcing his way through the day his team encounters a blizzard on the way home which forces them to turn around. He awakes the next day to find that it is the day he just lived. Hilarity ensues and in the end he discovers he must find happiness and his true self before he is able to snap out of his funk. He falls in love with his coworker Rita played by Andie MacDowell and they live happily ever after. The theme of this film kind of reminds me of Jerry McGuire except it is actually funny.

Author: 25 June 2020
Review_Url: The movie gets entertaining quick. It's kind of cynic comedy gets to you and is all well the majority of the time. Although the end does play out like this has been a long time fantasy from the director.

Author: 15 March 2011
Review: A weatherman is sent to cover a story about a groundhog named Punxsutawney Phil.
Review_Url: A weatherman is sent to cover a story about a groundhog named Punxsutawney Phil. He is not happy about covering the story because this is his third year. After doing the story and awaking the following day he discovers that "Groundhog Day" is happening all over again, and again, and again. He at first goes crazy about it and then he starts to realize that he can use this to his advantage. He then realizes that he will spend the rest of his life in the same place, with the same people doing the same thing. Phil Conners is the selfish weatherman for the local station WPBH-TV, Pittsburgh. He has no respect for hi co-workers as well as the viewers. He absolutely hates "Groundhog Day" which is held in Punxsutawney, Pennsylvania. Phil is to cover this event with Rita and Larry who are the new producer and cameraman. After doing the broadcast Phil wants to leave Punxsutawney, Pennsylvania immediately. However, a snowstorm leaves them spending another night. When Phil wakes the next morning he believes he is experiencing déjà vu because he is reliving Groundhog Day all over again. He keeps reliving this day after day after day. He realizes that this may be his fate but also figures out that his actions have no consequences, but the knowledge can help him gain information about what he wants especially when it comes to Rita. Phil is given ample opportunity time after time to get the day "right". Just like in the movie "50 First Dates" where a veterinarian has to keep winning the heart of a girl he fell in love with because she has a short term memory. With every new day he has to start over and make sure he gets it right. In this movie the motif is relevant to this movie because it is where they keep repeating the same day. This is important because it helps the view to understand the theme of the movie. The lighting in this movie was high-key lighting which helped create an effective image for the viewers. All Phil Conners had to do was get the day "right". Until this happened he would keep reliving the same day. This helped him gain knowledge on some stuff he needed but it also helped him realize that he would spend the rest of his life with the same people doing the same thing every day. He was given plenty of days to get it right.

Author: 19 August 1999
Review: My favorite movie of all time. Watch this movie!
Review_Url: This movie nothing short of fantastic -- one of the most under-rated movies of all time.  I've watched it more than a dozen times, and I'll never tire of it.  It is totally entertaining, totally thought provoking, and totally inspirational.  Every time I watch it I feel like a new man, with a new day before me in which I can do anything I want.  What a feeling!  My hat is off to Harold Ramis, Danny Rubin, Bill Murray and Andie MacDowell.

Author: 9 February 2000
Review: Flawless comedy with Bill Murray's best performance
Review_Url: My favourite film.

Author: 4 May 2012
Review_Url: I love this movie for all the obvious comedic reasons, but what makes it special for me is how it perfectly captured 4 years of my life at my companies regional meetings. We literally discussed word for word the same issues and solutions for 4 straight years every three months. The only thing different was the backgrounds of the power-point presentations and the % differences in growth quarter after quarter. About 3 meetings into this trend, I dubbed our meetings groundhog day. Did they change? Sadly no, they just started saying, "we want to avoid another 'groundhog day' in every presentation. I hope you are able to avoid this tragedy at your company. Great movie, and hilarious business analogy.

Author: 6 December 2000
Review_Url: What makes Groundhog Day special is that it is not only philosophically deeper than most movies, but also socially relevant.  How many people in this world have often felt like they're living the same day over and over again?  So many that Groundhog Day has now become a synonym for a monotonous lifestyle.  People can often be heard saying, "I feel like I'm in Groundhog Day."  How many movies have inspired a new expression in the English language?  Not many.

Author: 4 August 2001
Review_Url: I think this movie is really good and worth of your time and money. I think that it's great how Phil learns from his mistakes. This movie is funny enough to watch over and over again and never get bored. Bill Murray does a great job of acting in this film, and he makes you believe that it is really happening in real life. Please, watch this movie, you'll love it.

Author: 24 August 2003
Review: What if there was no tomorrow... there wasn't today????
Review_Url: This is a movie you will love or hate! Many people love and many more people love it! The basic plot of the movie is like this... There is this news reporter guy that goes to report on the Groundhog's day activities in PA.  He hates his job and pretty much everything about his life and he enjoys being a jerk to anyone and everyone he can. He ends up spending day after day after day in the same exact location. Each morning he wakes up and it is the same day. There have been many papers/ stories written on the idea of immortality and this story is one of the best. It asks the question how should you spend your life here on earth.  It is a very funny movie and it doesn't get too much into ethical issues.  What would you do with yourself if you had like 10 years to do nothing???

Author: 28 December 2003
Review_Url: Despite having read the reviews, I just wasn't ready for what a delight this film was. I'm normally not a fan of the "smarmy" school of humor that's so popular with the original bunch of Saturday Night Live alums: Chase, Belushi, Murray, et al. The "humor" in their characters all too often consists of them being "cooler" than the rest of the world, and laughing at those less "cool". And if you want to be "cool", too, you'd better laugh with them. It's humor as high school clique. Of the lot of them, I've always found Bill Murray to be the most tolerable; but even he rode the edge of my tolerance.

Author: 3 January 2018
Review_Url: Groundhog Day has quite the fame of being this unique classic. In that regard, Groundhog Day is a fairly entertaining story about redemption and self-discovery of one's own behavior. It has Bill Murray in a performance that boasts toward both the devilish and the heartfelt and a safely entertaining amount of jokes and gags. Some of its middle, mainly how the character of Bill Murray deals with his condition, feels somewhat unbeliavable, but the movie quickly finds a way to remind you of the charm it carries.

Author: 3 February 2019
Review_Url: A great film & story looking at the process of maturity & life reflection.

Author: 24 June 2001
Review: This is not just a Comedy:
Review_Url: This is not just a comedy gives you a dry laugh. I believe this is a comedy with good philosophy content. In a sense most of us are repeating our lives over and over again. Get out form the bed, go to work, go lunch at some deli, go home at 5¡K Everyday is the same day like yesterday, nothing exciting happens. However, the important thing is how are we going to live today, the one just like every other day? The film used the groundhog festival wisely as a moral. Like Phil the groundhog, you can look at your own shadow in cold winter but do nothing, or you can use today to make a difference, open yourself to welcome a coming new Spring. Watch again the movie, you will find the message within this awesome film.

Author: 2 January 2001
Review: One of the greatest movies ever made
Review_Url: I truly believe that this is one of the greatest movies ever made.  Simply put, the premise of the movie is based upon the belief that we are doomed to repeat the errors of our lives unless we learn from them, but applies this principle literally to the main character Phil.

Author: 22 March 2001
Review_Url: What a movie !!!!!!... i remember that i saw this picture at first time in TV in a hazard way... and i was trapped... it cracked my head... and i can´t believe that i didn´t heard of this picture before... if you didn´t watch it yet.. DO IT NOW !!!!!!!!

Author: 15 April 2005
Review_Url: This is one of my top 5 movies of all time. It is one of a very short list that I have seen over 10 times. I never get bored with it because the setting of the movie is so convincingly laid out that you feel like you are able to spy on the characters as the story unfolds. This is a rare quality that I have only seen with a few other movies: "Fargo", "Cape Fear" (the one with DeNiro), and "It's a Wonderful Life" It is similar to how you would feel if you were able to see a film of close friends in an entertaining story. You feel as you know the people and the place. Fantastic! Bill Murray is Outstanding!! Chris Elliot is a funny supporting character. Andie McDowell, however, leaves question as to Bill Murray's Characters taste in women (a little too angelic for my taste - doesn't fit at all with his character). The townspeople have a strong role in this picture. They are the Currier and Ives simple-folk backdrop to Bill Murray's city-slicker character.

Author: 16 August 2022
Review_Url: This light hearted comedy is perhaps Bill Murray's finest performance. Going through a renaissance of sorts since the Millennium, Murray has evolved into a much more serious actor.

Author: 2 March 2018
Review_Url:
Inspires me a lot.. 
Sometimes we need to take break from life itself like giving a pause to life, I guess.
That's why death is there to keep life valuable.
also if we keep taking break, then there will be no fear of death.. :) I believe

Author: 20 October 2021
Review_Url:
I'm fairly certain that I have seen this movie at least 50 times and enjoy it very much. I have watched it 100% straight and 100% stoned on very good weed, my preference is to watch it quite stoned on primo bud. I have finally watched it so much that now I'm looking for real scientific miscalculations and the best that I can ascertain
is that there is one major inconsistency that just never gets thought about. Here it is: Phil is 100% aware that he is caught in a time-warp, reliving the same day continuously day after day. The inconsistency is that so does the rest of the town, except they are totally unaware that they too are living the same day over and over. Only Phil is aware that he has an ability to constantly change and improve. Everyone else experiences change,
but they are blissfully unaware that they too are reliving "Groundhog Day" over and over as well.

Author: 12 June 2020
Review_Url: Not sure why everyone calls this a classic. There were a couple of laughs but for the most part, I was bored with it. The movie was about him reliving the same day over and over. Yet, I got upset because he was reliving the same day over and over. Scrooged is actually one of my favorite Bill Murray movies.

Author: 7 February 2023
Review_Url: There are very few films I can watch more than once or twice, but I end up watching this every year. As a kid, it sparked my imagination, and as an adult, I appreciate the implications more and more. There's mystery, comedy, tragedy and romance, with a moving character arc. They weren't afraid to go to some dark places at times, but handled everything perfectly. Frankly, now I realize it must have taken some courage on the part of the producer to include some of the material in this romantic comedy, but it would have fallen short without it.

Author: 31 January 2008
Review_Url: This film is definitely a contender for the funniest film of the nineties.

Author: 7 March 2019
Review_Url: This movie is a timeless classic. Murray is the wise cracking cynical weather man whose life is dramatically changed when he is trapped in the same day for 34 years...

Author: 15 September 2005
Review_Url: This movie is incredible. It is definitely my favorite movie of all time. It's one of those films that could not be pulled off by any other actor.... only Bill Murray could fit this role as Phil Conners, and he fits it perfectly. The incredible extent of his whimsical acting in this film is 80% of what makes it one of the greatest films I have ever seen... the other 20% belonging to the great storyline and supporting characters.

Author: 6 March 2018
Review_Url: Groundhog Day is a movie about a creepy shtbag who relives the same day over and over and uses that inconvenience to gaslight and manipulate women into thinking that he's not a creepy shtbag. In some alternative universe (1993?) this is apparently supposed to be funny or romantic. Imagine how many women viewers have been fed this "your love can change the a**hole"-narrative over the decades. As per usual in this genre, all the women are also portrayed as sex-objects who are either airheads or without much of a personality. Not to mention the illogical time-concept where he bumps into the exact same people in the same place despite having skipped events, unlike the day before. The protagonist clearly isn't the sharpest knife in the box, considering that he never even made a serious effort to leave town and go to bed somewhere else to see if the time loop is bound to the hotel/town where he's visiting. Apart from the rampant sexism and lack of logic, you can also predict the ending about half way into the movie. This movie is hardly alone in pushing the very destructive "it's just part of the romance when a guy is being a dipsht to you"-agenda, and that is exactly what is so terrifying. The frequency with which this agenda is pushed in this genre is partly why so many people can watch a movie like this without recognizing the problem of that this sexist dramaturgy both mirrors and contributes to creating sexist values in our society. Pure Hollywood garbage that should never have made in to the big screen.

Author: 21 June 2002
Review_Url: Not only is this a movie I could watch repeatedly and still laugh out loud, it presents spiritually significant questions which if taken seriously provide the viewer with an opportunity to consider some of the most meaningful issues of life through the lens of pure good natured fun. Bill Murray is at his best, witty, endearing, and likeable as a man wrestling with the ultimate monotony of life. Although a movie I watch when I feel I need a good laugh, it vaults past superficial laughter with insightful comments like "What would you do if you could live forever?" An excellent question, and Murray's characters conclusion is warmly provocative.

Author: 19 March 2018
Review_Url: This was my first time seeing this movie and I enjoyed it just as much as I imagine most people did. It was an idea that has been done many times. This movie is one of the original movies with this idea and I think it was executed as well as it could have been. I liked seeing how his outlook on life changed every time he had to repeat the same day over and over again. It was obvious the first couple of days were going to be him trying to figure out what was happening. my favorite parts in this movie were when he had finally realized he could do anything he wanted with no consequences. He punched an annoying friend in the face, he said anything he wanted and he even killed himself....many times. Even though he didn't know exactly why this was happening he used it to his advantage. he used it to pick up girls and every time he would mess up on a date he could easily start the whole date over again because he knew the day would start completely over and nothing he did stuck. He would learn new information about people to impress them and pretend he was someone he was not. He was definitely smart but he did these things because he was bored and wanted to see how much he could get away with. I also enjoyed how relatable it was. I imagine ay person would go through the exact process that Bill Murray went through in this movie. The end was obvious but I still enjoyed watching him grow as a person. He began to do good deeds which he never would have done in the beginning of the movie. He becomes a genuinely good person and that is how he gets out of repeating the exact same day over and over again. Groundhog Day was funny when it wanted to be but serious when it needed to be. It was overall a very well thought out movie and I enjoyed it very much.

Author: 19 March 2018
Review_Url: This movie was really good in my opinion. Its hard to make a movie that repeats the same day funny and Bill Murray made it funny his performance was very good. My favorite part is the beginning when he realizes that he is repeating the days he does everything that people would think of doing such as getting chased by the cops or robbing a bank. Also in the movie you see Murray's attitude change as he relives the days and he starts to feel sympathy for himself and others. It also made like the movie a little more and I would watch this movie again.

Author: 6 April 2006
Review_Url: I checked the spoiler so as to not be accused of revealing anything that isn't already known. With that said, this film is a classic tale of redemption ala A Christmas Carol. Instead of ghosts showing him the errors of his ways and warning of the consequences, it is that he must live his in an unchanging way until it dawns on him that life is not what he made of it but what he should make of it. The most poignant part of the film is where he tries to save the life of the old man and realizes that there are things in life which are already determined and are immutable, but most of life is changeable. Listening to the soundtrack evokes powerful responses and imagery. I dare you to see this film and listen to the soundtrack and not be moved. This is what makes this film so great. Just like Scrooge, his transformation is complete and his life will be forever changed for the better.

Author: 18 March 2001
Review: An inspirational and witty comic fantasy
Review_Url: This film is amazing.  Not only has Harold Ramis used wit and intelligence in a hilarious comedy as he did in Ghostbusters, but he has delivered a feel-good masterpiece that makes one think twice about the direction of their lives.  This film had much more than a story to tell, (although it's appearance of The Twilight Zone gone comedy is breathtaking) but it actually enlightens the audience to a whole new world of possibilities within their lives. Bill Murray is at his best as a cruel and cynnical but witty Pittsburg weatherman named Phil Connors.  After going to the small but lively town of Punxatawney to report the groundhog festival, he learns that he is doomed to repeat the same day over and over again.... until he gets it right. The antics Phil goes about are wonderfully imaginative, sparking the question in everyone's mind: What would you do if there were no tomorrow? When the film gets a bit more serious, Phil decides to impress the woman he secretly loves (Andie McDowell).  Unfortunately, every day she wakes up without any memory of yesterday.  Phil is the only one who this happens to.

Author: 28 May 2001
Review_Url: This movie is great.  I watch it every Groundhogs Day and even others and still love it.  I keep on laughing at all the humor even though I've heard them so much.  I think that it is amazing how well this movie works...no other movie have I watched as many times and still liked it. Okay maybe a movie when I was a youngster I watched billions of times but come on, I'm talking now. I recommend everyone to see it and enjoy it.  It is great to watch on February 2nd of every year.

Author: 15 April 2006
Review_Url: If Groundhog Day for Phil Connors (Bill Murray) is the day he relives thousands upon thousands of times, then Groundhog Day for me is the movie I rewatch thousands upon thousands of times. You can watch this film many times before it is the case that you don't pick up on some new nuance of gesture from Murray or some other subtle perfection. One of my favourite lines: "You wanna know about the weather? You're asking the wrong Phil. I'll tell you about the weather. It's cold and it's grey and it's gonna last the rest of your life." His descent into despair allows for some of the best comedy of the film...Nowhere can a great comedian shine better than as a character who has hit rock bottom and has nothing left to lose

Author: 19 January 2002
Review_Url: Hilarious!  A classic for the Bill Murray fan.  Andie MacDowell is subtly sexy as always.  What I appreciate most about this unique film is that it realistically addresses a question all of us have asked ourselves before..."What would I have done differently if I could do it again?"  (I wouldn't have raised my voice at my senior prom date--a stunningly attractive girl--because she didn't wait until I opened the car door for her.  We didn't know each other well to begin with and it ruined the evening.) We see through Murray the transformation of a man from self-centered to sharing, cold-hearted to caring, as he re-lives the same day over and over and over again.  My favorite scene involved a dinner date with Murray's film love interest, Andie MacDowell.  As they dine across from one another, discussing their interests, hopes and dreams, Andie highlights her love for European classics (or something similarly mundane).  Murray's character, in classic alpha-male form, bursts out laughing like "that's the dumbest thing I've ever heard in my life."  Andie is visibly hurt.  Cut to the next scene--same dinner, same conversation.  Andie--"I love European classics."  Murray - meditating on the profundity of Andie's statement, quotes a poem from that period...in French!  Andie--"I didn't know you had such an appreciation for those works."  Murray--"Oui"  (French for yes) Score 10 pts. for Murray in Andie's book.  For one day, we get to see someone live a regret-free, no holds barred, do want you want to, anything goes day.  Yesterday's mistake becomes today's victory!  I (obviously) haven't seen the film in awhile, but I recall little profanity and no nudity or violence, making it (somewhat) kid appropriate.  One of my favorite comedies of all time.

Author: 13 October 2018
Review: Will your 3rd Feb. come? 60816 1101 Zhou Yuhan
Review_Url:
Last Monday,I watched a film called Groundhog Day,which leaves me a deep impression on the fantasy and romance containing in it. Although released in 1993,the film has an incredible insight into life in 21st century. The hero Phil is played by Bill Murray,while Andie,the actress,characterizes Rita's features vividly. Directed by Harold Ramis,the film has won 6 wins and 17 nominations. You won't be regret to enjoy it.
 The story begins normally,a weatherman with his team is going to cover the annual Groundhog festivities in Punxsutawney. However,the arrogance inside Phil and the ordinary village become contradictory,which drives the next actions. Ironically,Phil finds out that he awakes at 6 every morning,and then,suffer from the same day, 2nd Feb. He cannot leave the town,nor commit a suicide. Sometimes tricks are played,to date a woman or make fun of others. Gradually,he fills himself by learning skills and helping people in need. Subtle changes eventually make him a better person. At last,Rita falls in love with this kind man and 3rd Feb. comes.
 Murray portray the role Phil in a particular way. When he realizes that he have to undertake the same day again,first he shows unbelievable,then there is curiosity and boredom. All of these,psychological actions are presented by Murray's gestures and facial expressions. Nevertheless,Rita's part is also attractive since she is the main point of Phil's life. The shift attitude of the supporting roles matters undoubtedly. In all,their acting performance is successful through the gradations.
 The film techniques are rather simple but meaningful. One repeated and classical shot is the 6:00 a.m. clock. The clock turns 6 and music begins,then we all know the same day misery happens again. More interestingly,because the film shoots repeated scene,every decorations and locations of actors must be accurately right. I suppose that was a tolerant.
 The first theme is apparent,which teaches us to treasure and to be a good person.And the second one is my own assumption. In contemporary life,many people live exhaustedly and numbly,have nothing changed,thus no passion for life and their 3rd Feb. never comes. They just live one day for a thousand times,instead of living a thousand days for themselves. This is quite alarming,and makes us rethink.
 Many successes are mentioned,though the repeated plots seem to be a little boring. In conclusion,this is a movie that suits lovers and friends at weekend. I will give six stars out of ten. 
 3180104970 Zhou Yuhan

Author: 12 February 1999
Review_Url: This surpasses all the expectations one would have for the kind of movie that it appears to be: a whimsical comedy based on a 'what if?' premise, in which some fundamental assumption about the universe around us is altered, to amusing effect.  Films in this particular sub-genre (does it have a name? I think of these as 'Twilight Zone' comedies) have a certain appeal for me, but most supply a few laughs, not much more.  I usually come away from them with a sense of an opportunity missed, due to sloppy execution or lack of imagination.  The screenplay of "Groundhog Day" is outstanding, in that its creators evidently gave much thought to answering the question: if a person found himself inescapably, eternally repeating the same day in his life, just what _would_ he do?  The execution of this 'thought experiment' is so thorough that it passes beyond hilarity, beyond cleverness -- though the film has both qualities in abundance -- to reach a level of psychological, even spiritual profundity that puts Groundhog Day in league with the very best examples of its type, "It's a Wonderful Life" and "A Christmas Carol". All this from a Bill Murray comedy -- who would have thought! ("Scrooged", Bill's own version of the "Christmas Carol" story, wilts in comparison.) Anyone who liked "The Truman Show" ought to love this.  It crackles, it surprises, and it even moves, with Murray's dry wit steering us clear of sentimentality.  Watch and enjoy it again and again.

Author: 6 April 1999
Review_Url: If a work of art is something which can express most complex ideas in a seemingly simple way, then this movie definitely is a great manifestation of artistic genius. You can watch this movie as a good-humoured comedy turning around the crazy idea of the same day repeating over and over and have all the fun you can ask for. The cast is great, with Bill Murray going through all the highs and lows coming with his situation, Andie McDowell at her loveliest and Chris Elliott delivering great one-liners. When you start thinking it over, it occurs to you that the script touches on the last questions of human existence. It's not easy to postpone the question about life's sense, when there is no more tomorrow to postpone it until. Watching the flick, you might not immediately notice the plot's depth, just as it takes Bill Murray's character some time to realize the time-loop he's caught in. But once it gets to you, it won't let go of you.

Author: 27 March 2006
Review_Url: I'm not sure if anyone else has noticed this, but the movie seems to follow the Buddhist path to enlightenment almost exactly. For anyone who doesn't know, the path is similar to the steps that people go through when dealing with failure or death. First there is confusion, then denial, then anger, then reasoning, and then acceptance. In Buddhism, one has to first realize that there is suffering. Phil does not realize what is happening at first; it's a shock that the day is repeating. He goes to sleep the first few times, hoping the day will change. When it doesn't, he gets angry and begins to kill himself in numerous ways. In Buddhism, this would be akin to living life frivolously. Once Phil realizes this will not end the day, he begins to do good things. This is the bargaining stage. However, this is not true altruism in that he is only doing good in order to escape the day. It is not until he accepts his fate that he begins to do good simply for the sake of doing good, and not for selfish reasons. This is the first real step in attaining enlightenment: accepting that life is suffering, and choosing to ease the suffering of others. Through this idea, Phil is finally able to escape the day, which would be akin to escaping the cycle of reincarnation and attaining nirvana. Essentially, Phil is going through this cycle on a microscopic basis, one day at a time instead of one life at a time. Sorry for the long explanation, I just thought it was fascinating that such a funny and entertaining movie could have such a deep undercurrent, whether the producers meant it or not.

Author: 26 May 2000
Review: Bill Murray plays the ultimate himself in the best comedy ever!!
Review_Url: How is it possible that you can still get a romantic feeling with a hilarious movie like this? Bill Murray changes his personality for 100%, from "I don't give a damn f*ck", to "Caring about everything surrounding him" by facing him with his own activities from the day before, over and over again. The problem for Bill is, that all these days are one the same day, from beginning til end

Author: 15 November 2000
Review_Url: Personally, I think Groundhog Day was one of the largest revolutions in my movie watching hobby to this date! I had heard from certain people that it was good, and from some people that it wasn't so great...I don't have a clue what they were on about, because this is a very intelligent, well-thought out movie with a storyline that breaks all boundaries.

Author: 14 October 2019
Review_Url: Good movie but if bill Murray set the clock to 7:00 AM instead of 6:00 AM the plot would've probably fixed itself.

Author: 20 May 2006
Review: Groundhog Day and how I wish I could live it.
Review_Url: This movie to me is excellent. You couldn't have found a better cast to play the characters in it. I am sure many people wish that they could relive a day in their life and do things to make it better. Even though it is fantasy, and that the movies can make fantasy come true. It has been a wish for centuries. You have heard people say " I wish I could go back in time and know what I know now" and to me this is what this movie represents. I had to see this movie several times before the true theme sank in. And in the end the character that Bill plays does a complete personality overhaul and finds nirvana. I think it is a wonderful picture, along the same genera as "A wonderful life".

Author: 16 December 2019
Review_Url:
I watched this film at least 10 times and kept asking afterwards why I was doing this.
I never watch a film twice, because I find it nonsensical. Maybe because there is no alternative. If it never gives the effect here

Author: 8 March 2001
Review_Url: If I start to give credits to this film it won't stop so I say only few well selected matter: -If you like Bill Murray, you gonna love this. -Andie MacDowell is great. -you can watch it over and over and over...

Author: 30 May 2003
Review: Sadly, must be the greatest movie ever made
Review_Url: I won't pretend this is any great artistic achievement, and probably not even Murray's finest work, but every time this thing comes on TV (which is quite often), I sit watching from Feb 1 all the way to Feb 3.

Author: 29 October 2002
Review: First in a trio of fantasy movies
Review_Url: Harold Ramis has an offbeat and upbeat taste for science fiction and flights of fancy, as his earnest performance in Ghostbusters would have us believe. And he reinforces this vision in Groundhog Day, the beginning of a triptych of lighthearted fantasy films (the other two are Multiplicity and Bedazzled).  Their intelligent directing and writing will make you feel at the same time a little happier, and a little smarter, by movie's end.

Author: 1 July 2020
Review: Want the scoop? I've got you babe!
Review_Url: I watch Groundhog Day on February 2nd every year and it never gets old. This movie is my FAVORITE movie of ALL time. You may wonder, how can Groundhog Day be my favorite movie of all time? Well lead actor has to play a role, right? Bill Murray is a comedic genius. He so perfectly blends seriousness with being funny. I don't know that anyone else could have done that role any better than Bill. Bill had perfect chemistry with co-lead Andie MacDowell, and to the point where it was believable. Sometimes you see couples in movies and you wonder how they would ever mesh...well these two make it work perfectly.

Author: 20 November 2020
Review_Url: Groundhog Day is the other feature-length film of the Twilight Zone and like the Twilight Zone, it's neither good nor bad it just is. Like the Twilight Zone, the time loop is never explained on why it started, why the main heroine falling in love genuinely was important or him falling in love with the town as well. It's like a slow burn where Phil loses his mind. We start off by getting to know him and understanding his personality. He's arrogant and narcissistic, pretty much an unlikeable guy that hates the setting of the movie. Then we get to the loop of the film when Phil realizes that he is constantly repeating the day and feels hopeless. Then he has this epiphany that he can do whatever he wants. He is later seen taking advantage of the time loop and using it to satisfy his desires. He binge eats, smokes, steals money, and sleeps around (Groundhog Day, 34:00-40:00). He's living a carefree life and doing as he pleases. This scene is where the Twilight Zone episode starts. As we watch him do all of the things that frankly anyone one would do if given the opportunity we start to see that doing whatever he wants is getting boring and really wants to get out. Then as the movie progresses we start to see not only personality-wise but physically how this is taking a toll on him. When he starts helping people out there is this scary wisdom behind his eyes. The man literally remembers killing himself with a groundhog he saw his own death. Yeah, he gives the homeless man money, gets coffee to his coworkers, learns how to play the piano, and ice sculpts. He even dedicates his time to save the old homeless man. He then spends the next loop saving and helping everyone. Then he is thanked by everyone at the party (Groundhog Day, 1:10:25- 1:29:00). Through this montage of him helping people and him growing as a person, we should also remember that he was basically broken down mentally to get to this place of kindness and wisdom by this supernatural force that has no origin. With all of that being said I love this movie. It's promoted as being a Romantic Comedy but when looking at it from a modern perspective it's actually a psychological supernatural comedy film with a dash of dark humor. It's really fascinating how time and shifts the tone and mood of a film. I recommend people watching this movie only to see how messed up in a classic Twilight Zone way it is.

Author: 2 January 2007
Review_Url: If I were to classify this film, I think I'd call it "Romantic Comedy/Fantasy". But that hardly does it justice. Bill Murray, as the obnoxious Pittsburgh weatherman Phil Connors, is hilarious, as usual. He was the perfect choice to play the self-centered Phil. To sum up the plot, if you haven't seen it: Phil travels to Punxsutawney, PA with producer Rita (Andie McDowell) & cameraman Larry (Chris Elliot) to cover the Annual Groundhog Day Celebration. (A real-life event, by the way.) After covering the celebration, they're stranded there by a blizzard. Phil awakens the next morning, or so he thinks, and soon learns a terrible truth: He's entered some kind of time loop & must live the same day over & over, again & again & again... Phil realizes that he can work this to his advantage. At first, he uses it as an excuse to abandon self-control & avoid responsibility. He takes up some unhealthy & risky habits, knowing that he can start over each day. He soon becomes despondent, however & tries to kill himself several times. Of course, he fails for obvious reasons. Eventually, he starts reaching out to help others in the community, which earns him their respect. In the process, he becomes a better person. But more to the point: Beneath the surface, Groundhog Day has a deeper meaning. The basic premise, in itself, raises the question: What power created the temporal loop in the first place? Was it God, karma or some unknown cosmic force? How long was Phil actually in the loop? Days? Years? Centuries? Would time have any meaning while he was in there? I think the movie purposely leaves these things to our imagination. Why has Phil been "sentenced" to relive this day indefinitely? Is it a divine judgment on his character? Is this his "Hell" or "Purgatory"? Is his karma catching up with him? Let's look at how Phil's life is changed by his experience: In the beginning, he's rude, obnoxious & self-centered. Being trapped in the time warp, at first, brings out his negative personality traits when he realizes that his behavior can have no apparent consequences. Some examples: He punches out a pushy insurance salesman. He steals money from an armored truck. He uses women, including Rita (on whom he has a serious crush). He smokes, drinks & overeats. He makes rude comments on-camera at the Groundhog Day Celebration. After several unsuccessful attempts at suicide, Phil begins to soften. He begins using the knowledge he's gained to reach out to others. He soon learns how to be in the right place at the right time to help people in need. Some examples of this: He saves the Groundhog Festival emcee from choking. He catches a little boy who falls out of a tree. He changes a flat tire for some elderly ladies. He comes to the aid of a homeless man & prevents him from dying of a heart attack. He even learns to play the piano & takes up ice sculpting. Phil eventually wins Rita's heart. Then he's released from the temporal loop & time again progresses normally for him. We can see, from this, how Phil Connors learns from his mistakes, changes his attitude & his outlook on life, steps out of his self-centered little world & is finally able to show true love & compassion for others. There's a definite theme of redemption & salvation here, which should appeal to Christians. Because Phil is given countless chances to change his ways, this could symbolize God's infinite mercy. This would appeal to Jews, Christians & Muslims alike. Hindus & Buddhists would appreciate how Phil begins to build up good karma through selfless acts of kindness. Phil's eventually release from the time warp may symbolize a rebirth, reincarnation, an ascension to Heaven or some sort passage into the afterlife. In conclusion, Groundhog Day, besides being a great comedy, is rich in symbolism. We could all learn something from it. I highly recommend watching it. If you've already seen it, see it again (& again & again & ...). Yes, I know it was released in 1993, but it's timeless. (Pun intended.)

Author: 22 October 2001
Review_Url: Now in 2001 I've just seen Groundhog day for the very first time, on DVD. What a refreshing film. It's very funny in it's repetition and utterly true in it's movements.

Author: 20 November 2001
Review_Url: What a great movie.  This by far is one of my favorite movies of all time. Bill Murray is one my favorite actors.  He is at his best in this one.  I think the story line and the setting is what helps make it so great.

Author: 4 December 2021
Review_Url: Phil spending an entire day making as many people happy as humanly possible is literally just me on my final 3-day cycle before I fight the final boss in Majora's Mask.

Author: 3 June 2002
Review_Url: Despite of my pitiful attempt for a one line summary my perception of the movie was (and is) that it certainly is one of the best movies I've seen. The idea, though it repeats in many sci-fi series is always a refreshing one, when implemented with enough skill, like in this case.

Author: 4 February 2023
Review: Why didn't I see this movie sooner?
Review_Url: I have no idea how I missed this gem. If you're like me and have waited far too long to see it... do it! Charming & really gets you thinking.

Author: 19 April 2005
Review_Url: Now this is another of the typical, all-American eat-the-psychology-raw style of movies. It starts quite engaging with the repetition of the same day, over and over.

Author: 11 February 2023
Review: Easy to see why it is a classic
Review_Url: I think this is hands down one of the most well thoughtout and well written movies I have ever watched. Groundhog Day is just a masterclass in filmmaking, it was so well done. The pacing, the characters, the actors behind them and the overall direction is just superb/absolutely top notch and it should be no surprise at all why so many people consider this to be one of the best movies of all time. A movie that is constantly referenced and payed homage too even after all this time. If you haven't seen it already, I would say that the sooner you give this a chance the better. (And prepare for many rewatches)

Author: 3 June 2023
Review_Url: It's so good. I kept on thinking that what the ending will be. It's the best ending and so romantic.

Author: 23 July 2002
Review_Url: You know what ? This is the finest movie I've ever seen. Bill Murray is fantastic , like always... I can see this movie for a million times. So, if someday in my life I'll have a "groundhog day", and on a TV channel will be playing "Groundhog Day", I'll watch the movie every night. Trust me !

Author: 25 January 2003
Review_Url: They say that the simplest premises are always the best, and this movie seems to be living proof of that.  Breaking with what seems to be the tradition here, I'm not going to use excessively long words that no-ones heard of before, but suffice to say that this is probably the most that Bill Murray has ever been.  Its rare that an actor is so suited to a role as in this film.  As to the plot, its subtle yet effective, and very cleverly done for such a basic idea.

Author: 7 October 2003
Review_Url: There are some films that leave some emotional marks in us and this is one of them. There are some much life lessons in this film that it's hard to start to comment just one. Great film, great characters, great story.

Author: 7 February 2010
Review_Url: This is great classical comedy about man called Phil who's day is repeating over and over again. Phil than realizes that he can use this to impress young producer (Andie MacDowell) and eventually build a relationship out of it. But as his day goes on and on and every second day she doesn't remember a thing he trys to kill himself but that doesn't work either and Phil is desperate ...........

Author: 16 August 2010
Review_Url: Phil Connor is a weatherman who travels every year to Pennsylvania to film the Grounhog day. He hates this day and now it's his third time. Now the day begins to repeat and repeat. It stops repeating when he changes his character. We watched this movie in our culture class. I lerned a little bit more about the American culture. But we didn't have popcorn because our teacher don't like it. It was very special to watch a movie in class. We saw a man who sang for a woman during the film. Now we have new people in class and they didn't have very much fun because they didn't see the film. Today I explained the new people what the film is about.

Author: 30 January 2015
Review: Do yourself a favor this Groundhog Day...
Review_Url: ...and watch this show. I know I will again, 'cause it's a family tradition!

Author: 23 June 2003
Review_Url: One of the best comedies ever.  Whenever it's on tv I just have to watch it no matter what.  I especially love the beautiful setting in the movie and how the characters develop.  I know the concept of the 'day that repeats itself' has been done before but in this movie it's perfect and legitimate.

Author: 21 October 2003
Review: Wonderful, A Christmas Carol for all seasons
Review_Url: I'm surprised this movie isn't more widely appreciated, it's at least as life affirming as the Shawshank Redemption which seems to be over appreciated (a nice film though). I think the title doesn't help, especially outside the USA. When I first heard of this movie I expected some gross-out comedy to be watched with a few beers on a Saturday night. What a wonderful surprise it was to see a movie I knew would always be one of my all-time favourites.

Author: 6 February 2023
Review_Url: Bill Murray exquisitely plays an insufferable egotist who, surprise, can actually learn something new about life, even though the lesson must be repeated an untold number of times. I find that strangely hopeful. Brilliantly shot despite its being pre-digital. A born optimist, Andie MacDowell's character provides a perfect foil to the cynicism of Murray's character, Yet, somehow, the movie is not sickly, sweet, but strangely compelling. Kudos to the writers and to the people who shot this because they managed to make the movie visually and artistically interesting, even though the same day's activities are shown over and over again.

Author: 20 November 2003
Review_Url: I have a feeling I'm going to regret this...

Author: 24 March 2014
Review: a nice film to watch i guess
Review_Url: When I read the plot of this movie, it really made me curious. How would it really be, if there was no tomorrow? How would I react, and what could I do to stop it? Well, Phil (the main character of the film) was prisoned at the groundhog day, and couldn't find a way to live the next day. That did lead him to something really inspiring and thoughtful. After many things he tried in order to make 2nd of February seem somehow different, he couldn't manage to change it.

Author: 20 February 2013
Review_Url: First,I should say that I watched it just because of Bill Murray! And I love all thing what are in this movie.

Author: 4 May 2013
Review_Url: Harold Ramis's "Groundhog Day" (1993) is a romantic comedy that is filled with laughter, love, and at times a feeling of hopelessness, over and over again. "Groundhog Day" is a about a local, self-centered weatherman named Phil Connors (Bill Murray) who has been sent to cover the infamous February 2nd festivities, better known as Groundhog Day, in a small town named Punxsutawney, Pa. Teamed with his lovely, well- grounded producer named Rita (Andie MacDowell) and his young, wise cracking cameraman named Larry (Chris Elliot), the three make the annual pilgrimage from Pittsburg to Punxsutawney for this historic event.

Author: 18 May 2014
Review: The most wonderful comedy of the 90's
Review_Url: Groundhog day released in 1993 is the best movie that I have ever seen. I have seen many movies. More than a thousand and it is much better than most of them. One of the better aspects of this movie is its humor. It is rich, intelligent and never vulgar. There are some romantic scenes, they are not my favorites but I have seen worst. I forgot to tell the movie genre it is a comedy mostly with romance and some philosophical themes. The main actor is Bill Murray who gives a stronger performance in his comedies (like Ghostbuster) than many other actors. I could even say than it is his best and more nuanced performance. I have never felt such different emotions than when watching this movie. It is much better than other comedies of the 90's. Watch it! It will make you cry, laugh and ultimately think.

Author: 5 August 2013
Review: Great movie! Well written and produced!
Review_Url: The film Groundhog Day takes place in Pennsylvania and is based around an annual celebration of Groundhogs Day itself. Bill Murray plays a person named Phil Connors who seems to be an arrogant self-centered individual who does not want to utilize his profession to cover this event. He works alongside his news producer named Rita who is played by actress Andie MacDowell. Phil Connors also has a cameraman for the news station named Larry who is played by Chris Elliott. Phil Connors shows up at the Groundhog Day event to do the coverage of this event even though he is not wanting to. Phil Connors plays a meteorologist in this film and he does not predict the weather right on this day. A big snowstorm hits the small town in Pennsylvania where he is covering the Groundhog Day events. When this occurs Phil keeps reliving the same day over and over again.

Author: 19 March 2017
Review_Url: Groundhog Day, it's a movie we watched in film appreciation class. I personally think movies should contain certain theme and messages that we can observe. However, this movie's theme is not clear for me, and do not know what messages the director wants to give to the audiences. There were some few laughing points that entertained me, but it was more like a B class comedy film.

Author: 17 February 2020
Review: The "tightest" movie I've seen, underrated too
Review_Url: (It's a shame this film is not on the IMDB top 250, as it is better than most on that list. The Academy was AWOL as well, only the Brits were sharp enough to award it.)

Author: 1 February 2015
Review: The kind of movie you can watch over and over again.
Review_Url: Bill Murray does his best role ever. His type of persona fits his character to perfection.

Author: 6 December 2005
Review: Most underrated movie of all time
Review_Url: Every once in a while all the elements of a movie will come together making it a great movie. Groundhog Day makes you laugh, makes you cry, makes you think. The only reason Groundhog Day originally received as much playtime as it did was because it was a generic "holiday" movie. It's played almost as many times on free TV as Bill Murry relives February 2nd. I, like many, watched it the first time just because it was there.

Author: 19 May 2018
Review_Url: It is fascinating to watch a film with massive fame running before itself. Usually because you get the sense that your opinion on the film is of great importance, due to how people would view you afterwards. For a critic, this dilemma is routine.

Author: 27 February 2017
Review_Url: Groundhog Day is work a work of marvelous comedy. This comedy exudes from the natural inclination to be humored by the hysterical facial expressions and the unfortunate situations Phil, Bill Murray, is placed in along the ride. It uses the somewhat mind boggling circumstance that the comical Bill Murray is stuck in time, and the situations involving romanticism, death, anarchy, and other natural human desires that may not be the best in certain situations. These experiences Phil finds himself creates not only just amusement and a reason to laugh, but also they make us think and feel for how we would've responded to such a phenomenon as defying space and time. Inspiring us with its progressive attitude of growth and morals, it makes us want to be better people and to mature, hopefully in a far less amount of time that repeating a single day hundreds of times. It exceeds in not just reaching those who want a good laugh, but also accomplishes speaking, through film, to those facing romantic struggles, depression, a weak will to live, and other such issues most humans experience throughout their lifetime. Though it did achieve a lot with such a small concept, related to humanities struggles, and gave us hope for a matured self, I could not reconcile the fact that Rita, Phil's love in the end (played by Andy McDowell), would settle for a man such as Phil. The movie also was vague, other than the fact that Phil had been a jerk and a prideful snob, about the reason that Phil had been sentenced to such a temporary fate as he was in Groundhog Day but it doesn't shed much light off of the great film that it is. It struts many of the great concepts of comedy that we all know and love and influences us to be better people. All in all, it is a stand-up movie that will not disappoint after a lazy night of movie-watching!

Author: 27 March 2017
Review_Url: Groundhog Day used the formula of character + situation exceptionally. I got some good laughs with this movie but because it kept repeating and with only few changes by the middle of the movie it became quite tedious. The story was good and comical. I definitely recommend this movie.

Author: 3 August 2018
Review_Url: I really enjoyed this movie! I suggest it to everyone

Author: 23 October 2005
Review: The movie show one guy's quality really.
Review_Url: I just think it's not only a funny movie ,but also a special,wonderful one .We should thank Danny Rubin,the story writer ,who created a great script for this movie. Bill Murray did very well . When he knew he could live in this day all the time ,he did something that any guys would do: First,sex ; (very easy) Second,a lot of money; (not hard ) Third,a woman he love (very hard ) so,although he knew a lot of things about "Rita" ,but he found that the love of woman is very hard to get .In fact ,he understood something should be changed in himself ,and he should know himself , understand the value of people's life and even the meaning of true love .So, he tried to change himself ,and he did it in the end . From all of comments above ,we even can get a standard way of many guys ,they work very hard ,they earn money for fun or sex ,but they can't get true love of woman he love .It's so sarcastic,isn't it? 'Cause that need a big change in himself ,it's the most hard thing,nobody like change ,it's truth ,but they did it in the end just for true love of the woman. so,I think the movie show one guy's quality really.

Author: 20 June 2017
Review: Good, not as GREAT as I remembered.
Review_Url: Its a good comedic situation, and explores even the human condition through repetition.

Author: 12 March 2018
Review_Url: Its been over 25 years and some change since I seen this masterpiece of a movie I cant believe it. So many movies have copied this repeat of 1 day but nothing like the original. I love the movies of the 80's and 90's the supporting actors were just as good as the Lead actors! Or just excellent casting directors!

Author: 19 May 2018
Review_Url: I think this was a super funny romance and it was a good idea for bill murry to play phil!

Author: 26 June 2018
Review_Url: Groundhog day proves you don't need to rely on CGI explosions, fart gags or graphic sex to make an entertaining, classic movie. It's full of humanity and heart and genuinely winning performances and that's why it's so loved after all these years. I wish people would still fund midlevel movies like this!!!
